intro: Cynorkis citrina, commonly known as the yellow orchid, is a species of orchid native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
